task.summary:
"Implement user authentication and management features"
New classes and methods have been added to the system to implement features relating to user authentication and management. These changes include the creation of a `User` class in the domain level, a `UserController`, as well as related methods and properties for creating and managing users. Additionally, an exception `UserAlreadyExistsException` was added to handle the case where a new user attempts to register with an already existing username. An `AddNewUser` feature was also created to handle the addition of new users and related exception handling. The 'User' and 'Authenticate' features were also mapped for use.
These changes enable the system to register and handle users effectively, providing the functionality for users to create accounts, log in, and manage their details. The new structure also ensures proper error handling and feedback in case of issues such as attempting to create an already existing user.

"Add pagination and modify user creation and authentication
The changes include several enhancements and modifications. First, a new Pagination feature has been introduced for better scalability and handling of large datasets. New files and classes related to pagination logic (PagedList.cs, PaginationHeader.cs, UserParams.cs) were added.
Changes were also made to the User creation process and authentication. The 'CreatedAt' field in User.cs now defaults to current date if not explicitly specified. Also, special exception handling has been added specifically for the case when a user already exists (UserAlreadyExistException).
In the authentication controller, error handling messages were updated to provide a more clear reason in case of a failure.
Also, the appsettings.json file was deleted to likely move configurations elsewhere for better security.
Lastly, CORS support has been added to allow cross-origin requests in the system."

Enabled CORS policy in API
Updated the 'Program.cs' file in the RDF.Arcana.API project to apply a CORS policy. This change is important for the client-side application to be able to consume the API properly, in compliance with the security measures.

Remove outdated UserEntity, add new Tables
Deleted the InitialCreateUserEntity, AdjustUserEntity and their respective designer files as they are outdated. Added new entities Classes: Department, ProductCategory, ProductSubCategory, MeatType, Uom, Customer, Items, Company, Location and Role. For each of these entities: added a new Class, added the entity to the DbContext, and generated a migration "20230718080414_AddUserAndSetupEntities". Removed 4 classes from Migrations. Added 6 new feature classes and exceptions. Adding these new entities will support the new structure of the system, with the required fields and relationships.

Add department and user functionalities, modify database relationships
Added multiple new properties to the User domain model, such as CompanyId, DepartmentId, LocationId, RoleId, and their corresponding navigation properties to establish a relationship. Also added a method to update department status in the DepartmentController. Updated database relationships, eliminated their direct relationship with the Customer entity, and created a direct relationship with the User entity. This change was made to ensure data integrity and encapsulation since a user now has a department, a role and is part of a company and a location.

Remove old migration files `20230719052435_AdjustUserEntityandCustomerEntity.cs` and `20230719052435_AdjustUserEntityandCustomerEntity.Designer.cs`
These files were deleted due to the re-architecture of the User and Customer entities. The relationships between User, Customer, Company, Department, and Location were updated. The old migrations no longer reflected the current state of the database schema, hence they were removed. Updates were made to DataContextModelSnapshot reflecting these changes.

Refactor database relations and constraints
This commit removes the direct relationship between Customer and Company, Location, Department, and Role entities, and instead adds customerId as a foreign key to Department and Location entities. It further sets a one-to-one relationship between User and Company and many-to-one relationships between User and the other three entities. The reason behind this restructuring is to align more with the business logic where a company has many users who can belong to many departments and locations. This makes data handling more streamlined and logical.

Remove redundant files and migrations
Deleted .gitignore and efCoreCommonOptions.xml files from .idea directory and "AddUserAndSetupEntities" migration files from RDF.Arcana.API project.
The .idea directory files were IDE-specific and not needed in the repository. The migration files were redundant as corresponding database changes have been reverted.

Remove user specific features and files
Removed unnecessary features, classes and corresponding files that were related to `User` as they were causing code redundancy and maintenance overhead. Refactored certain classes to point to `Customer` instead of `User`.
Also, updated migration file to reflect structural changes of the database due to these modifications. Simplified `DepartmentController` to only handle basic department functions.
The purpose of these changes is to simplify the overall application structure and bring focus to customer related features.
